byline.contributor: Amie Tsang reported from Hong Kong and Cao Li contributed research from Beijing.
byline.original: By AMIE TSANG and CAO LI

abstract: China's growing middle class embraces imported and local craft beers, growing the market many times over since 2009; large brewers like Anheuser-Busch InBev and SABMiller see opportunity in China, and are investing heavily in hopes of attracting more discerning customers.
lead_paragraph: Chinese consumers are swapping mass-produced local beers for a bevy of imports and locally brewed brands, and a merged Anheuser-Busch InBev-SABMiller aims to capitalize.

headline.main: China Embraces Craft Beers, and Brewing Giants Take Notice

snippet: Chinese consumers are swapping mass-produced local beers for a bevy of imports and locally brewed brands, and a merged Anheuser-Busch InBev-SABMiller aims to capitalize.
